name: 休閒產業組織行為研究
description: This course covers the foundation for the study and application of organizational behavior. The perspective, historical background, methodology and theoretical framework for human behavior in organizations for hospitality and tourism industries are studied. Attention is given to the micro perspective (perception, personality and attitudes, motivation, and learning), the dynamics (group dynamics, conflict, stress, power and politics, and leadership), and organizational culture. Applications for performance improvement, organizational change, and development are stressed.
goals: Know the challenges faced by today’s hospitality and tourism organizations.
Deal with today’s hospitality and tourism workforce.
Demonstrate the competencies needed by effective hospitality and tourism managers.
Understand the importance of effective hospitality and tourism organizational behavior.
Negotiate effectively in cross-cultural settings and the dot-com, global workplace
syllabus: Course Descriptions 1.Leisure Organizational Management addresses the employment demands of the sport, recreation, and leisure sector. 2.Phenomenal growth has occurred, and is predicted to continue well into the future, for the career opportunities targeted by this program. 3.These diverse and expanding sectors are bolstered by the globalization of the leisure and tourism industry.
